intro: Trichera calycina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous small, dry seeds. Trichera calycina is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. It is an important plant in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in local ecosystems.
